availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Buchanan (Jefferson County, Kentucky, physician and coroner.)

body.p: Jefferson County, Kentucky, physician and coroner. Nelson County, Kentucky, native. Married to Charity Boulware Buchanan in Shelby County, Kentucky on February 23, 1832. Father of Henry M. Buchanan, Hamet A. Buchanan, C. A. Buchanan, Samuel Buchanan, James M. Buchanan, Burns Buchanan, and Joseph Buchanan. Physician in Shelby County in 1850. Coroner in Jefferson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 1, p. 321.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville/Ward 3, p. 712.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Monroe County, p. 372A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Shelby County Marriages, Film #005552479.
